target: You come across an Engi wreck with one life-sign aboard; it turns out to be a Suzerain, and the sole survivor of the Mantis boarding party that wiped out the ship's crew. He's in no state to fight and he's brought aboard.
Release him.
Kill him.
(Mantis Crew) Interrogate him.
(Mind Control) Interrogate him.

Your mind control device allows you to quickly get his story without resistance. It appears the boarding party was attempting to steal an weapon that the Engi ship was transporting. However their team was wiped out by drones.
Continue...
You find the weapon in a hidden storage hold and decide to patch the ship up enough to let the Mantis leave.
You help get the Engi ship up and running but take some of their supplies. He takes off without another word.
He takes your mercy as a sign of weakness and rigs up a small timed explosive before making off in the Engi vessel.
The Mantis Suzerain shows no fear as the airlock's inner doors are sealed and space prepares to take him. You press the switch and then he's gone, whisked out into the great black.
You strip the Engi ship before preparing to deal with the Mantis. However, the Suzerain immediately realizes your intentions and attacks!

It's not clear what occurs between the two Mantis behind the locked door, but when they emerge the Suzerain is prepared to provide telemetry on the local sector. He then leaves on the Engi ship. Your map has been updated.

After a short time alone with the Suzerain, you are told he wishes to join the crew. Although you are surprised at the Suzerain's willingness to swap allegiances, you trust your crewmembers' judgement about him.

This node is currently home to a Mantis leisure ship: a place of brothels and combat arenas for warriors to release steam. When they scan your inventory they indicate that you're eligible to engage in a grand game of chance.
You don't gamble with crooks. Prepare to jump.
Better not to get involved in what's going on in there.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Bet 50 scrap on the warrior with blue paint.
You watch over the view-screen as two Mantis juveniles are pitched at one another in combat.
Continue...
Bet 50 scrap on the warrior with red paint.
You watch over the view-screen as two Mantis juveniles are pitched at one another in combat.
Continue...
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent. You claim your winnings!
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe.
Pay what you owe.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.
(Adv. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.
You are able to get out of firing range of the cruiser before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.
Continue...
The blue Mantis seems sure to win, scoring numerous hits on his enemy. However, the one in red ends the fight with a single key swipe. You claim your winnings!
The one in blue gets pressed into a corner, but he lashes out at the last moment, decapitating his opponent.
Pay what you owe.
You transfer over the scrap that you bet and quit while you still have a ship to sail off in.
(Adv. Engines) Dodge the debt and power up the engines.
You recall the scrap you prepared to send and are able to get out of the cruiser's firing range before they can react. However, a smaller ship breaks off from a patrol and moves in to engage.
Continue...
Continue...
A Mantis military ship appears on local radar alongside the remains of a human freighter. Prepare for a hostile encounter!
A Mantis military scout hails your ship. "Foolish alien! You has stifled greatness for too long! You rue the day you back the Federation!"
A small Mantis cruiser is broadcasting a repeating message on a wide-band frequency, "Non-Mantis ship that enter territory are forfeit. Lower shields and surrender if value your lives."

You detect a small military outpost and a few freighters nearby. This mineral rich planet in an isolated location would be perfect for an illegal Mantis mining operation. As you consider your options, a ship launches from the outpost. Prepare for a fight.
You discover yet another unlicensed and uncharted Mantis colony. They certainly waste no time expanding their claims. A Mantis ship moves to intercept you before you can jump away.
A Mantis military scout seems to have just finished a salvage op on a nearby wreck. They have no time to waste with warnings and appear to wish to fight.
A small military craft hails you and a Mantis captain appears on your receiver. "All local colonies punished for Federation's transgressions. Submit to processing."
A nearby Mantis ship begins aggressive maneuvers. You prepare for the worst.
A stream of clicks and gurgling comes on the comm from a hostile Mantis scout. The universal translator might be on the blink, but his intent is obvious.
The Mantis ship is pleased to see you, and fires up its weapon systems.
You recognize the outline of a Mantis ship against the blackness. Engage!
Something red looms. It's the Mantis.
A Mantis vessel hails you. "Hail is merely distraction!" You notice their shields and weapons have come online.
You notice a flurry of laser fire glance by the port window. The Mantis are upon you.
The Mantis hail you. Their captain says, "I claim vessel for my clan. Good hunting!"
A Mantis female comes on the vidscreen. The females don't make it to authority unless they're particularly vicious. You power the weapons.
A Mantis ship with the markings of a warrior tribe breaks position and attacks!
A Mantis ship hails: "Ah! Fine prey. Fine prey! We honor with most eviscerating arsenal!" You sense a cloud to this silver lining and power the weapons.
Children on Earth are told terrible tales of the blood red Mantis invasion ships - much like the one bearing down on you now - which once threatened the planet. You order weapons free!
A youthful-looking Mantis captain hails. "You, prey, must know. Your death, Kaaazthwak's final kill before maturity. Kaaazthwak pay respects." Seems respects in Mantis culture are paid with lasers.
You are immediately hailed by an impressive looking Mantis ship, "Ship make a mighty fine prize. Prepare for battle!"
Continue...
You catch up with the Mantis ship that escaped before, only to see them transferring their crew into an even bigger ship!
Continue...
"Not YOU again! You know how much repairs going to cost me? Time to take the big guns."
Continue...
Who knows why the Mantis would venture so close to a sun. Perhaps it makes for more of a challenge?
Continue...
You're hailed by a Mantis vessel. "You not know how hard repair with claw is. Teleporter is broken, can you fix? We will pay you, as we are so kind."
Agree to help repair their teleporter.
(Upg. Doors) Agree, but lock your doors tight in case of a trap.
(Repair Drone) Dispatch the repair drone to fix it. [-1 dronepart]
(Repair Burst) Use the bomb to fix the teleporter. [-1 missile]
We can't help.
As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging through your doors! Their ship turns hostile, and you should prepare for a fight.
Continue...
Their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
As you dock your ship with the Mantis, they immediately come charging for your doors. Luckily they aren't able to break their way through, but you still have to deal with their ship.
Continue...
The Mantis do not seem to be attempting to trick you, and their teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
The Mantis are surprised to see a drone instead of crew, and it doesn't take long for them to reveal their hostile intentions. They cut up the drone and their ship turns hostile.
Continue...
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. It doesn't take long for the drone to fix it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.

The Mantis are surprised to see your burst weapon targeting their ship. Whether they always had hostile intentions or think your repair burst is a real weapon is irrelevant, because the Mantis have turned hostile.
Continue...
The Mantis's teleporter does indeed appear to be in critical condition. Your bomb promptly fixes it, and the Mantis pay you as promised.
"Fine. Tell truth, we lie. Now, we take supplies from you and make even better teleporter!"
Continue...
The Mantis don't attempt to push further.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A Mantis pirate ship defends this beacon, claiming to be one of the Hive's enforcers. They demand you pay them either scrap or a slave, or be obliterated.
Refuse.
You make it clear to the pirate that you have no interest in giving them anything but death. You both hurry to prepare for battle.
Continue...
Pay their fee.
The Mantis seem satisfied and fly away, leaving you to grumble over your lost scrap.
Hand over a slave.
The Mantis come aboard and pick one of your crew to take back with them. Your crew struggles, trying to free themselves, but the last you see of them is screaming, being dragged out of the ship.
Tempting as it is to clone your crew, you made the decision to give them up, and you aren't going to break Federation code for it.

A Slug and Mantis ship appear to be squaring off at this beacon, but weapons have not yet been fired. Both ships simultaneously hail you. The Slug speaks first, "Federation, how fortuitousss that sssomeone elssse who I'm ssssure will apprecccciate the humor of thessse feeble pea-brained Mantisss and their pitiful attemptsss at dialect!" The Mantis cuts them off, "You stupid ones! Listen, how you drag out s's. True sign of inferiority." Both ships eagerly await your input on the situation.
Agree that the Slugs are superior.
The Slug points at the Mantis and laughs, but is cut off when the Mantis becomes enraged and powers up its weapons and attacks!
Continue...
Agree that the Mantis are superior.
The Slug grumbles as the Mantis gloats. Furious at your shot at their ego, the Slug activates its weapon barrels towards you!
Continue...
Can't you both just get along?

The Mantis and Slug glance at each other for a solid minute before they both simultaneously say "nahhhh", and fly straight towards each other, weapons blazing. You fly away before you get caught up in the fighting.

The Slug cackles, his already massively inflated ego having been expanded once again. Though he clearly still thinks of you as inferior, he gives you some additional fuel along with the remains of the Mantis ship.
The Mantis lets out a cry of victory, and performs a strange ritual dance. They leave you with the remains of the Slug ship and fly away.
You arrive just in time to see an unusually well-armed Engi ship destroying a small pirate craft. A teleporter signal is detected...intruder on deck!
Continue...

A young Mantis in a charred uniform has teleported onto the deck. He begs for sanctuary from the Engi, and offers to serve in exchange for your protection. The Engi have already traced the teleporter signal and are offering a deal in exchange for the prisoner.
Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.
Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.
(Mind Control) Ensure the Mantis is passive before you make a decision.
Thanks to the Mantis's simple mind, it is quickly subdued by the effects of your mind control.
Side with the fugitive and fight the Engi ship.
Agree to offer up the Mantis in exchange for a bounty.
It was a trap! The Mantis manages to sabotage your engines before beaming away.
Continue...
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer.
Continue...
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis. He won't go easily, and causes serious damage before he can be captured.
The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. The young Mantis jerks to attention and assumes a battle stance. It was a trap!
Continue...
Seems this was meant to be a trap! However, with the Mantis still under the spell, they're unable to do any damage and you take them down quickly. Seems a fight is still inevitable.
Continue...
The Mantis expresses his thanks and prepares to help you fight his pursuer. You redirect the mind control from the Mantis and prepare to fight.
Continue...
The Engi captain is delighted, and quickly arranges for the transfer of the prisoner.
Fury sparks in the eyes of the Mantis, but because of the mind control he is barely able to do more than cause a single scratch on your floor before he collapses.

The pursuing ship responds with a completely unintelligible message. It becomes clear this was a trap, but fortunately because of the mind control you're able to take down the Mantis and move onto fighting the hijacked ship immediately.
Continue...
Attack the ship.
You prepare for combat.
Continue...
Attempt to remain concealed.
(Cloaking) Cloak to stay hidden.
You're greeted by a rare sight: a Mantis ship that appears not to have noticed you.
For once, you see the Mantis before they see you.
When they see the Mantis warship waiting in ambush at your intended coordinates, your crew is relieved to note you've jumped someway off the mark.
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "Negative, I kill more humans!" You gulp noticeably, but luckily they don't see you yet.
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "One on the right starting to rot. Take him down. Take off fingers. Put out of airlock." They certainly don't seem to be friendly...
You overhear Mantis comm chatter: "Agreed. Next ship your turn. Good hunting." They don't see you yet.
You power down non-essential systems and wait for the FTL drive to charge. They either don't want to fight or have failed to notice your ship, the latter being more likely.
Before you have a chance to slink away the Mantis ship notices you and powers up their weapons.
Continue...
You power down non-essential systems in an attempt to remain unnoticed. It looks like they are about to leave when suddenly they turn and set course toward you, weapons powered.
Continue...
You quickly cloak the ship and move out of immediate scanning range. You appear to have gotten away undetected.
You cloak and shut down non-essential systems. In a short time the Mantis ship jumps away, no doubt in search of prey.
You quickly cloak the ship, but not quickly enough. They spot you and move in to engage.
Continue...
Aid the civilian ship.
You frown, power up the weapons and prepare to engage the Mantis ship. Not today.
Continue...
Stay out of it.
A Mantis vessel flashes past your view-screen, weapons and engines at full. A tiny blip on the sensor readout marks its quarry.
You spot a Mantis ship hunting in the distance.
A Mantis ship engaging a civilian hails you. Sparks fly about his cockpit as he yells, "Stay out this human! Else you next!"
Local sensors pick up two ships engaged in a heated battle. It seems the Mantis military ship will surely defeat its prey.
You pick up a distress call from a civilian ship. It's being chased by a Mantis ship!
Smoking, the civilian ship limps on. You set your sights on the future.
The noise of the FTL spinning up almost drowns out the explosions. Almost.
You let them pass and try not to think about it.
You detect and retrieve an escape pod floating nearby. You consider returning it to space when you learn it's Mantis.
Jettison the pod.
You send the pod back out the airlock. You're not stupid.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Pry it open.
(Analyzer) Access the interior footage of the pod.
(Shell Crew) Have your Shell open the pod.
(Rock Crew) Have your Rock open the pod.
(Obelisk Crew) Have your Obelisk open the pod.
The footage shows the interior of the pod contains a rabid, aggitated Mantis. Knowing that opening it will only result in disaster, you opt to jettison it back out into space.

The footage shows a relaxed Mantis inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. Once you open it, the Mantis falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
The footage shows a human inside, anxiously awaiting their fate. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.
The Mantis inside is FURIOUS. He cuts the closest person in half with a single swipe. Kill it before anyone else is hurt.
The Mantis is shocked to see the crewmember it just slaughtered step out of the Clone Bay.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

As soon as the pod open up, an angry Mantis lash out and plant their claws on your Shell, which immediately causes it to combust as a self-defense reflex, neutralizing this threat. Due to their body structure, your crew member doesn't appear to have received any fatal wounds.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

Your crew member open up the pod...which releases a berserk Mantis that immediately leaps on your Rock. Despite the agitated state of their attacker, they appear to remain in control and lift the Mantis, before proceeding to slam that nuisance across the room, seemingly having not sustained any injuries from that attack. The crew isn't endangered anymore, but you'd better get to cleaning up the room after the bloody mess of that situation.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.

The Obelisk slowly advance towards the pod, seemingly puzzled at how such a primitive device in their eyes can function. Once they figure how to activate it, a rampaging Mantis emerge, immediately lashing at them. The Obelisk appears to be mostly annoyed at their futile swipes causing little effect on their sturdy body, but eventually grow tired and disintegrate their attacker, with ashes being the only traces remaining of the intruder.
As soon as you open the pod, the Mantis inside falls to the ground and grovels at your feet. "Oh most gracious and noble captain, you are sparing of me! Please, accepting my gratitude and service."
A man bursts out of the life-pod screaming and claws his way into a corner. A rare survivor of Mantis captivity. Once calm, the survivor offers to join your crew for a time.
Continue...
If you thought Mantis were deadly in other sectors, nothing can match the rage of a Mantis when you've entered their territory.
Hive Mantis aren't very friendly, but now that you've invaded their hive they'll stop at nothing to destroy your ship. A furious Mantis ship spots you and attacks.
You're hailed by a Mantis ship. "Federation fleshsack? Here in Hive? You have death wish. Let me grant it!"
You're greeted by the sight of a Mantis ship scavenging the remains of the last poor ship to have intruded on the Hive. Their attacker moves in to make you the next example.
You receive a hail from the Mantis ship at this beacon. "You come to Hive, so you must understand that you shall not leave Hive!"
A Mantis ship moves in to attack, set on the defending the Hive from your ship.
It doesn't take long for the Mantis ship here to notice you. They hail you. "Federation not welcome in Hive! You know this, yet you come here. Prepare die."
Something red looms. It's the Mantis.
Continue...
Continue...
Suzerains are no force to be reckoned with. Unfortunately this beacon currently hosts a Suzerain, and they seem eager to reckon with you.
A Suzerain ship approaches, ready to attack! You hurry to arm the guns.

Suzerains are chosen and trained by the Mantis Bishops to be the strongest warriors in the galaxy. Unfortunately for you, at this beacon you find yourself squared off against one of the Suzerain's ships.
At the first sight of the cyan hull, you know the ship at this beacon is a Suzerain. You prepare yourself for a fight.
Suzerains utilize both drone and boarding tech to kill their enemies. You find yourself face to face with a Suzerain ship and have no choice but to fight.
You're hailed by a Suzerain warrior aboard the nearby ship. "Ah, Federation ship. You are first kill I make since I become Suzerain! I thank you, and welcome you to death."
A Mantis ship hails you, and you go pale when you see it is led by a Suzerain. "You are no coward, yes? Good, I look for challenge. I welcome challenge! Prepare for bloodbath."

Those who are unlucky enough to encounter a Mantis Bishop are rarely able to tell the tale afterwards. The same might have been said for you, had it not been for the fact the ship here has not yet spotted you. There's still time to slip away if you desire.
We can take them!
You've decided to take a huge risk here and fight the Bishop vessel. Let's hope it pays off.
Continue...
Leave quickly.
As the Coalition receives the backing of the Mantis Hive, their ships can often be found here. Not the kind to miss out on the opportunity to destroy a Federation ship, they attack.
Continue...
You're hailed by a Mantis, who frantically moves around the room in circles before facing you. "The Hive's security compromised, your fault! Death is only way. I die, so that the Hive may live!"
Continue...
A Mantis station appears to be positioned here. For what reason you don't know, but the station deems you a threat and fires in your direction, leaving you with no choice but to fight back.
Continue...

A Clansman ship is already at this beacon. They hail you, their captain snickering. "Oh goodnesss, a Federation ssship here? I come here often to harrasss thessse freaksss for entertainment, but thisss isss too good a chance to missss!"
Continue...

This beacon is home to a Suzerain ship. They hail you, "I too old for this. Days long since having fought in Mantis-Human war, invasion of Earth left many scars of body and mind. Let not fight here, needless bloodshed from pointless hatred gets nowhere."
We will avenge all of those you killed!
"Ha, what did expect? Let us fight, so that he who dies here may go to bliss."
Continue...
(Mantis Crew) Convince the Suzerain to join you.
"You wish to form friendship? One, what, which lasts years come? Yes, accept I do."
Avoid them.
The Suzerain keeps true to their word and doesn't chase after you.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

A Mantis ship appears to be circling the area nearby the beacon. You intercept their conversation with what you assume to be their Suzerain leader, "No, no. We not yet kill living ship. We continue trying, but it hard without weapon. Last crew... suffocate. Quite unpleasant."
Offer to kill the "living ship", whatever that means.

The Mantis are shocked that you have the courage to hail them, but seem open to your offer. They explain that the ship in question is actually an automated Rebel ship that is lost and has begun to attack Mantis settlements, and that they have been dispatched to handle the issue. "You need something special if want to kill living ship. Do so and we are grateful, and pay you. Better accept help from enemy, than decapitated by Suzerain Karazawaka."
(Hacking) We have hacking.
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.
Continue...
(Cloaking) We have cloaking.
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.
Continue...
(Adv. Weapons) We have a superior weapon system.
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.
Continue...
(Anaerobic Crew) We have crew capable of surviving in no-oxygen environments.
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.
Continue...
(Missile Weapon) We have a missile weapon to bypass their defenses.
"Good, yes this might work. Come, we show you to ship." They lead you to the Auto-ship, which is in the middle of tormenting a civilian Mantis ship. You prepare to fight.
Continue...
We don't have anything special, but we're still just as qualified.
"No no! You not understand, this ship kill you if you not be prepare. You useless. Maybe Karazawaka spare us if we bring in dead Federation ship..."
Continue...
Attack the ship.
You have no interest but to kill the Mantis ship. You power up the weapons and engage.
Continue...
Fly away.
You suspect the Mantis ship must have seen you, but they make no attempt to pursue.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
"Surprising, we counting on you die, and we bring corpses back to leader. Still, this works too." You scrap the Auto-ship.
Ask for your pay.
The Mantis grumbles. "Fine, yes this promised. Here, take this, and never speak this again."

The Hive often sends about Jailer ships to abduct invaders, a term that also includes you. Luckily, the Jailer here has not yet seen you. You could attack the Jailer to try and free its captives, or escape while you still can.
Attack the ship.
You move in to destroy the Jailer, knowing that you'll have to kill their crew if you want the prisoners to live.
Continue...
(Armories + Teleporter) Storm the Jailer.

Your crew, armed to the teeth, board the Jailer and quickly take down the Suzerain crew staffing it. With the jailers turned prisoners, you free everyone locked up who you don't think will kill you immediately.
Avoid the Jailer.
The Jailer doesn't seem to notice as you slip away.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You've destroyed the Jailer, but unfortunately none of the captives survived the explosion. You scrap the remains and try to avoid the drifting corpses.

The Jailer's crew is dead but most of the captives survived the fight. Most of them request to be dropped off as soon as you're out of the Hive, but one volunteers to stay behind and work aboard your ship.

The Suzerains are chosen from birth by the Mantis Bishops to be trained as elite warriors in special institutions scattered around the Hive. One such complex has been set up on the planet nearby. If you had to guess, it's likely protected very well.
Fire on the complex.
As to be expected, your weapons can barely even dent their defenses. The minute you start shooting, you alert them to your presence, and one of their finest guards is dispatched to destroy you.
Continue...
(Teleporter) Send a boarding team to sabotage the complex.
Leave the complex alone.
You have more important things to do than go raiding important Mantis structures.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
You've defeated the guard, but you know more are no doubt on their way. You quickly scrap what you can and leave.
(Magnet Arm) Use the magnet to draw in some extra supplies.
Continue...

You try to maintain a lock on your crew's positions, but not long after they teleported in you can tell the situation gets heated. You hear the distinct sound of flesh being torn open and screams, followed by static. You order your crew to hurry back, but one of them is missing. With no other choice, you flee while you still can, but one of the complex's guards follow in pursuit.

Your recently murdered crew stumbles out of the Clone Bay, still clutching their throat. Once they're sure their head is still firmly attached to their body, they rush to help defend against the guard.
Continue...

You remain in contact with your crew as they journey through the maze-like, stainless steel hallways of the compound. Laying small handheld explosives wherever they can, your crew then hurry back undetected to the safety of your ship, where you remotely detonate the bombs. You can see the explosions shaking the building, and their defenses cave in. With no way to protect themselves from further attacks, they give in to your demands, and give over scrap and one of their Engi slaves. Upon interrogating the Engi, you learn that they have remarkably been able to pick up combat skills from watching the trainees, and you decide they will be useful amongst your crew.
Free Mantis returning to the Hive that they hate so much is rare, so it is considerably shocking to see a Free Mantis ship that appears to be making minor repairs at this beacon.
Attempt to communicate.

The Free Mantis is ecstatic to see you. "Perfect day, how glad we are to meet you here, Captain! We have important information to tell you. Here are co-ordinates of Mantis camp we find. Do with what you want, we must leave soon and return to clan. Best of luck."
Ignore the ship.
Though you doubt the ship poses a threat, you have no interest in communicating.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
A Mantis warcamp revealed to you by the Free Mantis is much smaller than expected. A single station surrounded by Mantis ships of different sizes orbits the beacon. They don't see you.
Attack the station, knowing it will anger the other, much larger ships.
You fly towards the station, attacking its main infrastructure. One of the largest ships detaches to defend the station.
Continue...
(Upg. Cloaking) Sabotage the station while hidden by your cloak.
(Adv. Cloaking) Sabotage the station while hidden by your cloak.
Hidden by your cloak, you successfully manage to deal massive damage to hull, compromising the station. The explosions send the docked Mantis ships flying away, leaving you alone with the wreck.
Leave.
You would have to be suicidal to attack any sort of Mantis camp, regardless of size. You fly away until you're certain you're out of their sight.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.
Hidden by your cloak, you successfully manage to deal massive damage to its hull, compromising the station. The explosions send the docked Mantis ships flying away, leaving you alone with the wreck.

You attempt to destroy the station, but your cloak gives out before you can successfully demolish the hull. The attack sends most of the docked ships flying away, but the station itself is still standing and not about to surrender itself to you.
Continue...
In a rare display of cowardice the remaining Mantis ships make no attempt to fight you and flee. You scrap the hull of the ship you just defeated before moving onto the station.
Force the station to surrender.
With no ships left to defend it, the station gives into your demands and hands over more scrap.

You can't help but shake the feeling you're being followed through this system. After some time spent running basic scans on the surroundings, it becomes clear your suspicions weren't unfounded. A Bishop vessel reveals itself, though its weapons are offline.
Wait to hear their message.

A female Bishop appears on the screen, out of breath as if she had been running despite being on a spaceship. "You are Federation Multiverse Vessel, correct? Please disregard informalities and past inconveniences, for her royal majesty Queen Leikonpliiinakra has request for you. We cannot offer you Hive's allegiance or promises of safe travels, but you shall be given esteemed honor of queen's thanks! And if you so insist, perhaps ample cash reward."
Listen to the offer.

"In this territory there is hatchery for future Suzerains and Bishops. However, dangerous rogue defectors have taken hold of the Hatchery. By order of the queen the eggs must be secured and moved to a new location. I will transfer the coordinates of Hatchery to you now. I hope to see you there."
Refuse.
"Disappointing stance, but I haven't time to protest. If you will not assist then it would be my recommendation you leave Hive quickly before Leikonpliiinakra's forces discover you."
Continue...
Risk nothing and attack immediately.
You're no man of patience, and even though this was likely something important, you've forgone that possibility entirely by making the first strike!
Continue...
Location of the Mantis hatchery.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
You've arrived at the Hatchery, but you don't see any sign of the other Bishop ship. There is, however, a massive Suzerain cruiser here. You aren't sure how to proceed.
Attack the Hatchery yourself.
The cruiser seems to have several Suzerains led by a Bishop. That messenger wasn't lying, this Hatchery must be important to deserve this much security. Time for a colossal fight!
Continue...
Avoid the Hatchery.
Without the other Bishop, you can't be certain what the plan is. It's better not to take the risk and leave while you're still alive.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

You happen to notice, that while you've been fighting, the other Bishop ship has arrived. However, instead of coming to assist you, it has instead landed next to the Hatchery and begun to load its cargo with the eggs. It seems they have no intentions of sticking around, so if you want to confront them you'll have to kill this cruiser quickly!
If you can't kill the Suzerain Cruiser before the time runs out, the Bishop will escape with the eggs.

It seems you weren't fast enough - and now the Bishop has jumped away with the eggs! The Suzerain cruiser has noticed as well, because it immediately switches focus from you onto the trajectory of the fleeing Bishop and jumps away after it! Seems this was all just one giant ruse...

The Suzerain cruiser has been defeated. The immense hull of the ship comes crashing down onto the planet's surface, though fortunately it lands in the nearby river rather than on the Hatchery itself. Below Mantis workers and Engi slaves flee, but the Bishop ship has not yet finished loading their cargo.
Confront the Bishop.
"You are surviving? Impossible, but impressive! You fight as well as my father!"
Why did you use us as distraction? What's going on?

"I did not plan for confrontation like this, but it is time I confess. I am Laiiikarkapi, the first female Bishop appointed since the founding of the Episcopacy under queen Riiipiokinith. It would seem I have failed her majesty Leikonpliiinakra, but it is greater service to Mantis-kind that I prevent these eggs from life of warriors than serve my purpose and raise them same as I was."
Where will you take the eggs then?

"I have arranged plans. Free Mantis colony, away from Hive, has agreed to take and raise them as their own. I have faith this will be a better home. I do not know what will happen to me after. It seems fate has it my death as traitor to Hive is certain. But a noble death it will be. That is not of worry to you. Be it may that I trick you, you have helped me greatly. I will show you how gain access to blueprints of cruiser you have defeated today, so that your Federation might take advantage of its power."
Offer to take her with you.

"Huh? You are serious? I would not normally consider, but... saving reality could mean pardon, and life in Federation better than death in Hive. Perhaps my legacy does not end here then. I will have my crew transport eggs on their own. They are capable. I shall be with you momentarily, captain."
Wish her the best of luck and carry on.
"Yes, may you having the best of luck as well. Perhaps you will hear news of my fate in Federation some time soon..."
Request her help in finding the queen.

"Huh? You are serious? I do not know what you are hoping to achieve, but it is certainly better than a certain death at hands of the Episcopacy. I will have my crew transport eggs on their own. They are capable. I shall be with you momentarily, captain."
Continue...

With Laiiikarkapi's directions and Kaz's plans, you should now be able to track down the Mantis Queen herself. This won't be easy, but who knows what you might able to accomplish if you pull this off. Make sure you keep Laiiikarkapi and Kazaaak around, as without them, you won't be able to find your way.
Location of the Mantis Hive.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

This is it- the Mantis Hive. No wonder it's so hard to find, as the bulk of the city is located in a massive cavern underground. Thermal power plants are scattered around massive pits of magma and a large city stands in the center. Even from such a distance, you can see the royal palace...
We have both Kaz and Lai, we can do this.
As you start to approach the palace, a Bishop guard stops you. "You cannot be here! You will regret stepping so close to her majesty's palace!"
Have Lai talk it out with the guard.
"So you carry two traitors, yet you still wish to gain access to Hive? I would kill you on spot, but the Queen has heard of dishonorable KazaaakplethKilik's arrival and wishes to see him..."
Continue into the palace.

You're ceremoniously 'welcomed' into the palace, and with some brief fanfare Leikonpliiinakra emerges, dressed in golden robes. By the way you see Kazaaak looking at her, she must be quite desirable for a Mantis. She pays little attention to you or Lai, instead flirting with the Mantis warrior by your side. After some exchanged formalities, she walks back into the palace and you are ushered to follow.
Follow.

The next location you find yourself in is a long dining hall, its tables decorated in Mantis cuisine. At last, Leikonpliiinakra speaks to your group as a whole, and strangely well spoken for a Mantis at that. "As soon as I heard my darling Kaz had returned, I knew you would come here. Sit, and feast as much as you like. We will discuss whatever business you have come here for after."
Continue...

You spend most of the feast in awkward silence, with only occasional conversation between Kazaaak and Leik. Eventually, things turn more serious. "I am not oblivious to Kaz's recent movements in Coalition space, but I have chosen to turn a blind eye to them. I can only expect that you have come here to negotiate the Hive's withdrawal from the alliance."
Yes.

"Then I'm afraid that I both cannot do such a thing nor would it have any impact. Even if I were to withdraw from the Coalition, which frankly is an idea I would not entirely be opposed to, you would have to convince the Leikonpliiinakra of every reality to withdraw as well. You might not realize it, but the Coalition has secured many realities of its own. But regardless of this, the Hive is not in a position to cut ties with the Coalition. After the Federation-Mantis War our economy has been in ruin, and the industrial might of the Kleptocracy and Theocracy have aided us greatly."
Oh...

With that conclusion made, Leik turns back to Kazaaak. "My apologies dear, but in your absence the Hive has not grown fond of you. But traveling in-arms with another traitor to the Episcopacy and a Federation Captain has not helped your image. I love you, but my role as queen means I must place the safety of the Hive first. It is clear where your line in the sand has been drawn, so this must mark the end of us. And I'm afraid there is another reason I have allowed you here: the capture of the fugitive you have brought with you, Laiiikarkapi. I apologize my dear, for it was my fault appointing you to this role. But such things cannot go unpunished. This is the last stop for all of you. I can at least promise you your funerals will be held with honor." Leikonpliiinakra stands up, and her guards draw their weapons. You hurry out of the palace just in time to witness a massive cruiser approaching to stop you! Seems it's time to fight your way out of here.
Continue...
We can't do this.
You are not prepared for this mission. Better to turn back now than risk going any further.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

The Bishop cruiser has been defeated. Clearly this ship must have had some importance, because without it the Bishop forces have scattered. From its wreckage you salvage a special weapon. With the knowledge Laiiikarkapi gave you with the Suzerain cruiser, you figure out how to access the ship's consoles and download its blueprints.
Demand Leikonpliiinakra surrenders.
Your demands are not met, and you aren't certain what you expected. It's not in the Mantis code of honor to surrender, and especially not to a Federation ship.
Destroy the palace.
Leave.
Destroy the palace.
Leave.

With its Bishop forces scattered and defenses damaged from the impact of the cruiser, the destruction of the palace does not take long. It's almost certain the queen was killed during the attack. You aren't certain what will become of the Hive now or its involvement in the Coalition, but your work here is done. More or less.

This is not the day for genocide. Killing the Queen like this would lead to the collapse of the Hive, and for all its done the Mantis don't deserve that fate. No more ships attempt to stop you as you leave.
